result.execSummary:
The defendant Glenn A Fernstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Pierce County 17CM20

Agent to consult with Defendant's treating professionals.
Evaluation and follow through with any recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glenn A Fernstrom

records.addlTxt: Terminated Regular
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

02:34 16CM150 (motion to revoke DJOC), 17CM20, 17CM57 also at this time. PM Defendant Glenn L Fernstrom in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sticht: defendant will not contest deferred in 16CM150, plead to Ct. 2 17CM20 moves to dismiss Ct. 1, moves to dismiss 17CM57, moves to dismiss 18CM235, S/W 1 year on each count concurrent, no objection to waiving court costs. Parties agree. Court revokes deferred JOC agreement and enters Judgment of Conviction on 16CM150.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  DEF PLEADS GUILTY Ct. 2 in 17CM20 court will also enter Judgment of Conviction on 16CM150.  Facts are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of 16CM150 and Ct. 2 in 17CM20, , court dismisses Ct. 1 in 17CM20, dismisses counts in 17CM57 and 18CM235. Sticht addresses the court--requests AODA through Probation and mental health assessment and follow through, maintain employment, Atty Nelson addresses the court, objects to employment requirement. Court orders:
S/W 1 year on 16CM150 and Ct. 2 in 17CM20, concurrent: Specific conditions of Probation--AODA Evaluation and follow through, mental evaluation if needed and follow through with recommendations, any other conditions recommended by Agent, defendant required to maintain employment unless Agent determines that mental health is an issue and not in best interest of the defendant to continue employment--Agent to consult with defendant's treating professionals, court finds defendant indigent and waives court costs and fees on both cases. Appeal Rights are given to the defendant. 02:57
filed by Atty Nelson

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on December 4, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

9:18 a.m.  Includes 17CM20 and 17CM57. Defendant Glenn A Fernstrom in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the parties.  Attorney Schwab has requested to be relieved of his duties as Public Defender on the case,  Defendant does not object to that.  See JA for scheduling of 16CM150 for revocation of DPA, set pre-trial and trial date for 17CM20 and 17CM57, status also within 30 days.  Schwab will submit order, Defendant to contact PD's Office. Sticht - submitted letter from victim, victim would like bond condition of no contact lifted.  Sticht does not object to no contact provision being lifted.  Defendant has no objection to bond condition being lifted. Court modifies condition to no abusive contact.  Defendant to sign new bond.  9:24 a.m.
Plea hearing on September 24, 2018 at 09:00 am.

3:09 Defendant Glenn A Fernstrom in court with attorney Adam Nero.  Defendant Glenn A Fernstrom in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 17CM20 heard at this time. OSullivan: requests motion stay open for period of time to look into some matters. Requests a signature bond be issued on 17CM20. Requests a continuance on trial on 17CM20. Nero agrees and does not oppose the continuance of the trial if a signature bond is ordered. Court: grants motion to hold open the motion to revoke. Orders a signature bond on 17CM20 $2000. Speedy trial request is withdrawn. Set 17CM20 for a PTC and jury trial can be removed.

03:06 Defendant Glenn A Fernstrom in court with Cert. Student Attorney L. McMullen. Rory E. O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. O'Sullivan: plead to count 1, deferred judgment of conviction for 12 months, no contact with Brietta Vasser, $349.20 restitution.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. DEF PLEADS GUILTY. Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and will withold judgemnt pending results of deferred judgment of conviction. Restitution in the amt of $349.20 in the DJOC. Court approves agreement and signs DJOC. 03:18

10:33 Defendant Glenn A. Fernstrom in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court with Def.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Court gives constitutional rights to the court room as a group. Each Defendant in a group exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court enters plea. OSullivan:$1000 signature bond with no contact. Nelson has no objection. Nelson states middle initial should be L not A. Court: return cash bond of $150.00.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
